question_sentence: How long was the delay granted to Meghan Markle in her privacy trial with The Mail on Sunday?
Low levels of which vitamin increase the odds of hospitalisation with Covid-19?
Which UK city has been found to be home to the largest number of rats?
Police are investigating an incident involving Labour leader Keir Starmer - but what happened?
choices: A Holborn shopkeeper accused him of stealing
He had a fight with a Conservative staffer outside the House of Commons
He broke royal protocol during a meeting at Buckingham Palace
He crashed his car into a cyclist

question_sentence: Special Forces commandos stormed a hijacked oil tanker off the cost of which of the UK’s islands?
A man in China has broken the world record for the most bees on a human body. How much did the bees weigh?
A student tricked several major newspapers into reporting the comeback of which long-closed shop?
What did Comic Relief announce they were axing this week?
choices: The biennial Red Nose Day show

question_sentence: How much has the UK’s much-maligned test-and-trace system cost?
Which of the following was one of just two people named in the EHRC report into anti-Semitism in Labour?
Military forces took control of the oil tanker Nave Andromeda after a suspected hijacking. Where did this happen?
evidence: British forces took control of the ship in the English Channel. Seven men were arrested in connection with the hijacking.

question_sentence: Amy Coney Barrett’s Supreme Court nomination was confirmed by the Senate and she was later sworn in. Who was the only Republican senator to vote against confirmation?
evidence: Sen. Susan Collins of Maine was the only Republican senator to vote with Democrats against Barrett’s nomination. The final vote was 52-48.

question_sentence: Tens of thousands of troops kicked off military exercises as a show of force to defend the Senkaku Islands. This is a coordinated effort between the US and which other country?
evidence: The US kicked off the joint military exercises — called Keen Sword 21 — with Japan, the country that has administered the island chain since 1972. It’s a direct challenge to China, which also claims jurisdiction over the islands.

question_sentence: What has been discovered on the sunlit surface of the moon for the first time?
evidence: NASA, with the help of its Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter and Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy airborne telescope, confirmed that trace amounts of water have been detected in soil on the sunlit surface of the moon.

question_sentence: Miles Taylor was identified as the “anonymous” author of a 2018 New York Times op-ed that spoke of an insider “resistance” within the Trump White House. In which federal agency was he a high-ranking official?
evidence: At the time of publication, Miles Taylor was deputy chief of staff to Department of Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen.

question_sentence: Walter Wallace Jr., a Black man, was shot and killed by police Monday afternoon, an episode that has led to protests and violent clashes in this city. Where did this happen?
evidence: Wallace was killed in Philadelphia and the incident was captured on video. He was brandishing a knife when police responded; his family says Wallace suffered from mental health issues, including bipolar disorder.

question_sentence: In a Senate Commerce Committee hearing this week, Ted Cruz accused which tech CEO of “behaving as a Democratic super PAC”?
evidence: Cruz went after Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, specifically over his handling of a New York Post article involving unverified allegations about Hunter Biden. The hearing revolved around Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act, a law that protects a company’s ability to moderate content as it sees fit.

question_sentence: Another hurricane made landfall this week in Louisiana. What was the storm’s name?
evidence: Hurricane Zeta made landfall this week as a Category 2 storm. It marked the 27th storm of the Atlantic hurricane season, one shy of tying the record for most storms in a season.

question_sentence: A social media post revealed that actress Scarlett Johansson and which “SNL” star were recently married?
evidence: The charity Meals On Wheels divulged that Johansson and Colin Jost were married last weekend in an “intimate ceremony,” adding that the gathering had adhered to “COVID-19 safety precautions as directed by the CDC.”

question_sentence: Which airline announced a promotional travel campaign called the “flight to somewhere”?
evidence: Qantas announced its “flight to somewhere,” a 24-hour, round-trip experience from Sydney to Uluru — the famed sandstone monolith in Australia’s outback — aimed at Australian travelers. The promotion comes after its earlier “flight to nowhere” campaign.
